  3. A' Bhuidheanach Bheag

A' Bhuidheanach Bheag

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

A' Bhuidheanach Bheag is a broad, domed summit on the spacious plateau to the east of the Drumochter Pass. The plateau lacks distinctive landforms but is wild and desolate.

 You have not climbed A' Bhuidheanach Bheag.

Region: Cairngorms

Altitude: 936 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.33/5
Rating: 2.3/5 (102 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Carn na Caim and A' Bhuidheanach Bheag from Drumochter

Other routes and challenges

The vast plateau is most easily reached using the track in the route above, but many variations are possible. One option is to start from Dalnaspidal Lodge and head up - following a line of grouse butts for a time - via Fuar Mhonadh.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Kingussie / Newtonmore Hotels

Kingussie / Newtonmore B&B

Kingussie / Newtonmore cottages

Cairngorms hostels

Panoramic summit view (click to open)
